template: Hello {{ message }} !

name: uibuilder/Simple Example
info:
[Front-End](/uib_simple)

This flow gets a "quote of the day" from the Internet and passes it
to uibuilder. It caches the result so that if you reload the page,
you get the last result back. The quote is updated every 30 minutes
during the day and evening.

"Simple" refers to the front-end code. While the flow looks a little
complex, it really isn't. A trigger (repeating), an Internet request,
a cache and uibuilder. The link nodes loop the control output from
uibuilder back to the cache.

## Configuration

Update the files:

* `index.html`
* `index.js`
* `index.css`

According to the example(s) in the 3 other comment nodes in this example.

Press the button on the trigger to start the flow.

name: index.html
info:
A simple uibuilder page

The elements below are dynamically updated when you send a msg to your uibuilder node.

Quote of the Day

{{ msg.payload.quote.body }}
{{ msg.payload.quote.author }}

The full msg object

{{ msg }}

name: index.js
index.css
index.html
info:
copy the following and paste into `index.html` ```html http-vue-loader/VueJS Example - Node-RED UI Builder

Example of loading a .vue file

Uses http-vue-loader in order to avoid a build step. Also see the Vue documentation on single file components.

This example uses a custom VueJS component called <my-component> which is defined in the file my-compontent.vue.

The custom component has two "props" (properties) that allow you to send data to it. These override the default greeting and name. By passing msg.payload.greeting and/or msg.payload.who in the msg from Node-RED, you will see the text change on-screen dynamically.

This text goes into the <slot> tags in the component. try removing this from index.html to see the default text.
```

```
